DOC.HEAD: Postponed for Fourth Time
DOC.TEXT: Martin Marietta will try for the fifth time tonight to launch its first commercial Titan 3 rocket with British and Japanese communications satellites. Stiff high-altitude winds forced a delay Tuesday night, just as they had on Monday. Technical and weather problems caused two postponements earlier in December. ``The upper level winds are too strong for Titan this evening,'' launch commentator Bob Gordon said Tuesday. The announcement came after the countdown reached the five-minute mark and was being held there for a weather evaluation. The launch was rescheduled for 7:21 p.m. today.
